Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, as you have completed this book, which is the last of medical science, through the completion of its content it has reached its end, and due to its explanations, and its demonstrations, and its declarations, I believe you have fully grasped this treatise, which is a part of the greatest operation, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most complex of medical operations in our region and in our time, is fraught with great peril due to the lack of knowledge about it, and the study of it has ceased; and there remain only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have led to many errors and misconceptions, as the understanding of its principles is closed, and its power and art extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has appeared to me that I should revive the order of this treatise according to the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of cautery tools and other surgical instruments be included as an addition to the declaration, and for the preparation of them, which is a necessary cause.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The cause for which there is no longer a skilled artisan with their hand in this our time is because the art of medicine is long, and requires that its practitioner be well-versed in anatomy, understanding the youth of the members and the shapes of those, and the conjunction and separation of them; and have knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the names of those, and their extraction; and also of the pulsating veins and the static ones, and the places of their emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is fitting, as he was small in stature but great in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of this at the beginning of this book; for those who are not aware of what we have told you about anatomy, they are not exempt from falling into errors that will lead to men's deaths, as you have seen many of them, some well-formed in this science but lacking in knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When you see a foolish doctor who has cut an abscess on the breast of a woman and cut some arteries in her breast so that much blood flows inside, causing the woman to die from it among others.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who tried to remove a stone from a man who had been suffering in his state; the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone with part of the bladder, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called for help to remove it, and you see that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who was paid a stipend by a duke in our land to perform surgery; he took a black crust that was supposed to be cut from the patient's thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture above the wound with pincers and pliers with strong tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then, according to their wishes, loosen the bandages, rest, and apply a cold compress for some days, and command that the inflammation be reduced; and thus, while the matter is still fresh and the wound open, it can heal and avoid destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And they will call upon him, and he will loosen the bandages, and success brings calm and thus reduces their pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, so that it cannot be restrained, and does not cease to spread the corruption throughout the member until the patient comes to danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And see another doctor who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it becomes ulcerated after some days, until the fire of his malignancy is increased over him by his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the pain in the bone is purely from melancholic humor, then it does not cover that it will come to him by a ferrous weapon, but rather it should be in the member which suffers that it is completely destroyed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation should be divided into two parts: one is in an operation associated with health, and another in work which poses danger to the most important dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this throughout all parts of this book where operations are performed with error and fear; it is therefore necessary for you to keep this and set that aside, so that the foolish do not take advantage to speak against you and slander you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your tools with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method for the grace of God to achieve salvation and glorious success, leave behind the terrible illnesses with difficult healing, and set aside your tools that make you afraid, so that cowardice in your faith and in your name does not abandon you: for more remains to your glory, both now and in eternity, for your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	They already slice open some of their wounds:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments badly, lest bad doctors become famous.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first, the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter organized within the book's sections is about foot care, in the forms of instruments and the use of cauterization tools, and anything else necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incisions and punctures, and the use of cups, plasters, and the extraction of arrows and similar objects. It is organized according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter ordered on the internal parts of the foot, and on the shapes of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	With fire cauterization and sharp medicine, and recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the youth of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what circumstances cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery's youth and the documents of it is a long and prolix topic, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and many scholars have spoken about it, and there are disagreements among them, and I am satisfied with a small part of their discourses, fearing prolongations.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cautery will confer relief to the entire universal connection, which is of material or its material, except for two connections, which are connections with their own material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the connection that is dry and lacks material, opinions differ; some say that cautery is beneficial for such conditions, while others claim the opposite, stating that cautery is not suitable for ailments caused by dryness and lack of moisture, as the nature of fire is dryness and heat, and it would be counterproductive to treat a dry and barren condition with something hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite claim that cautery is beneficial for all dry and barren ailments in the body, as when you compare the human body and its moisture to the connection of fire, you find the human body dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And he says through the argument of those who claim this, that he has personally discovered this through experimentation.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable for anyone to attempt this procedure if they are untrained and unexperienced in the art of cautery from prior study, as they must be familiar with the variety of human compositions, the disposition of diseases within them, their causes, and the circumstances of their occurrence, as well as the passage of time.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other circumstances, there is no cause for fear, especially in cases of pain and swelling, as all doctors agree on these treatments, and they are consistent in applying cautery to relieve them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, lie in cautery as a medicinal flame, for fire is simple; its action affects only the member being cauterized, without causing pain to other members adjacent to it, but rather, with a slight discomfort.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicinal flame reaches those members from which it diverges, and it strongly promotes healing in a member suffering from a difficult-to-heal disease, aiding greatly.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, due to its subtlety and the excellence of its substance, does not cause harm but rather serves as a superfluous aid. It is already known to us through experience and the long service of studying the art regarding the truth of causes; for this reason, I excuse you from the length of my speech. And if it were not that this secret fire, hidden in this brief moment, cannot be freely read by you, I would have revealed its nature and the quality of its operation in the body, as well as its expulsion of ailments, demonstrated through philosophical discourse, which would benefit your understanding.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know this, my children, that the best time for making cautery and applying pressure is in the season of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cautery is convenient at all times, so that the harm caused by time's passage is overshadowed by the healing effect of cautery, especially when cautery is for pains or necessary pains, severe and acute, which do not suffer from tardiness, lest one fear those that bring evil, which is better than allowing further harm to enter through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus, do not sit on your feet, my sons, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who believe that this illness, which is healed by cautery, will never return, and they pause at its consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not so much as they believe, for cautery is but a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humors which are the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, one may use cautery superfluously over medicine because of the desire for its strength and virtue in operation and the grandeur of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, according to the constitution of the illness and its location, and the virtue of it, and what is prepared in their bodies from the addition of superfluities and humors, and what has been acquired by them from food and similar causes; for the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in members with few superfluities and humors, so when dent cautery is performed for pain and similar reasons, it is possible that that pain will not return in them, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is said in popular speech that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is a false saying, as those who understand it believe there is no cure that surpasses medicine or any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and the understanding that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when one applies the methods of healing in some ailments, and those medicines do not help, and then at the end of the cause, one administers cautery, and it proves beneficial for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here onwards, it becomes clear that cautery is not the last resort of medicine, but according to the understanding of popular opinion and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that hot cautery is better than cold cautery, and they did not say this except for the equality of heat and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not burn unless it is absolutely true, for you have already seen and proven that it does not do so in every body but only in certain ones; cauterization with fire from gold is good and better than what they said; however, when you make cauterization with fire, it is not declared to you, because the gold is consumed according to the amount you want due to the heat of the fire, and if you adjust it over the fire, the gold melts into the fire, and some sheets fall into the fire so that the artisan can catch them by the occupation of that task.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterization with iron should be made more lightly and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	You have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and you have organized those from the beginning within the feet, so that now I am asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	With a hot cautery for head pain caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	**First Chapter**
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers upon the patient the benefit of heat and moisture, two remedies for accidents caused by cold, which is the root of many fluxes, known as rheumatism, from the head to the extremities, and flu-like symptoms, and also sleep disturbances, toothache and throat pain, and generally all illnesses that arise from cold, as well as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar conditions in those ailments.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is as follows: first, you must evacuate the illness with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head with a razor, and make that incision between your legs on a clean bench, and place their hands on the afflicted foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place the edge of your palm close to the razor's blade, between the patient's toes, and press down.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the inflamed area of the middle part of the foot has been determined, mark it with a sign and take the olive-shaped cautery whose form is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the healthy area marked with a sign, descending in such a way that the patient's hand is slowly constrained, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then slowly lift your hand and examine the area, and if you already see any bone exposed, as well as the quantity of gravel-like matter, raise your hand again, and if it does not return to that position against the instrument, or another one from that side, cool it down until you see the bone, as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply pressure to the engorged area at the border and leave it, ensuring that the scale of the burn is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with an ointment containing four ingredients until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens up, the better the limb gets, so it is better and more rejuvenated.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They also say that the bone should be cauterized within the flesh and hold the cautery until some part of the bone's specific nature is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then remove what is adjusted to the bone and clean it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say others that the pointed cautery should be used on the rear, as it first penetrates strongly into the bone, and then envelops it, and this is the form of the small cautery:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, the vapours of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not see these two types of cautery suitable for everyone, but rather for certain individuals out of necessity; and indeed, when it comes to health, better is the natural cure when possible; for the head is exposed due to the solution of continuity of its parts, as we have witnessed in other members, especially when the head of the malady is of a fiery nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that comes first is safer and better for me; from this one, and through this work, health is achieved.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and persistent pain occurs throughout the head, and these symptoms prolong the illness, one uses weapons, splints, tourniquets, emplasters, poultices, hot water, dogs, cats, feathers, and similar things; but especially if a cautery has already been applied that does not heal or benefit from any of those causes, then consider this: if the nature of the head illness is strong, it is not necessary to apply another cautery on top of it.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the side of the head where the skull is cracked using an internal cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skull open and expose the amount we have found, then cauterize that area with a cautery on the back left side of the head at a place called the "vas" – it is the location where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And apply your hand to it, do not expose the bones, for the disease finds great pain in this place, unlike all other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should apply this cauterization in its proper place, because you know that the cauterization with which the horns of the head and the occiput are treated is a more delicate cauterization than the one applied to the middle part of the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Capital chapters.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment of old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe pain in the head or a pain radiating to the eye occurs, it is necessary to use purifying medicines for the head and administer other treatments as mentioned regarding the various ailments; if these do not prove effective, then cauterization should be performed in two ways: either with acute, burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	You might use burning medicines or cautery, take a hot cloth and cut off the ends of it from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you should incise the place of pain in the temple with a scalpel until it is felt to be in the right place, as long as it remains hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then apply pressure to it as it is relaxed due to the release of constriction, and leave it for three hours; next, remove the compress and let the pain subside for two or three days, then apply a warm bath to the affected area until the pain disappears.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a poultice to it until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you choose to do this using some of the burning medicines that I have written about in the two treatises on burning medicines, then...
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Apply the cautery according to this manner: take a fire from the cautery whose shape is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a clavicle, because its head has the shape of a clavus (clover) with some curvature, and in the middle part of it, there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place your hand over the painful area, holding it in such a way that the pain does not become more intense, and slowly turn the cautery at a controlled speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that is clotted by the specific nature of the wound is equal to or greater than the capacity of the vessel, raise your hand so that the artery that remains below is not clotted, in order that no more blood flows out.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak it in salt water and place that over the area for three days; and afterwards apply a poultice with hot compresses until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, burn the end of the knife with a cautery, and be careful not to make an incision into an artery in this newly formed wound.
Capitol quart.	Capital quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of old wounds.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When treating an old wound as we have discussed in the previous section on cure and dividing maladies, and if the treatment does not take effect and the pain persists due to a lack of appropriate medication or fire cautery, you should ignite the cuticular cautery until it turns white. Then place your hand over the area for a moment as you make an incision along the length of the painful line, identifying the source of the greatest discomfort.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuation of the mandible, which is badly affected by chewing, and that the wound is not adhered and the nerves which are damaged, and that there is no muscle spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is concerning the care and prevention of the flow of blood from an artery that is cut, for in the cutting of it there is fear, especially to him who ignores what he does and is unstudious and impatient; and leaves the operation on him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And come to the remembrance of the regulation of the flow of accidental blood from the artery according to your manner in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this illness that does not respond to these cauterizations and you see the patient's condition tolerable, cauterize in the middle part of the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you find, administer the cauterizations that we have said in the chapter of artery constriction with cauterization having two blades, this is the better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear caused by friction and it is treated with lacrimal and other remedies as mentioned in the previous section, and if the pain persists, apply heat with a cautery. This is known as a "puncta," which has this form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the puncta close to the heat source, and it should be rotated around the entire ear, or in any pattern that relieves the pain.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Use the cautery along the edge of the ear pain gradually, until the area is relieved from the pressure.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery with the three points is applied all over the ear, and when it is removed, care should be taken of the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter .vi.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	**On the cauterization of tortuous (varicose) veins.**
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortuous veins that are cured and treated by cauterization are precisely those that come from varicose humors, as we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Cauterization should be avoided for this species that is caused by drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of tortuous vein with shaking and splashing and do not apply your treatment, know that you cauterize the illness in three places: first, you burn the tip of the auricle; second, a small portion on their temple; and third, the connection of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And hold the hot cautery against the opposite side of the afflicted part, for relaxation is only seen in the area that appears to be healed.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is that you apply the hot cautery to the base of the earlobe, slightly above the ear lobe, and on the temple, its length corresponding to the length of the finger, and hold your hand with the cautery until the quantity of the substance in the vein is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of the cautery, and it is special from the knife, whose shape is placed flat on the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it may be even more subtle, as you will see with your own eyes; and take care to avoid excessive roughness on its surface.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area that is exposed during the procedure until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and treatment with what we have mentioned does not help and the patient has no fever, then cauterize at four points: above all the joints of the head; also cauterize at the middle point of the head, as we have said; and cauterize the joint (or gland) under the chin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done as it has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more difficult to treat; and then apply what you have processed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	About the cauterization of oblivion performed by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	You should give the patient in the beginning small doses of herbs and pills, the servants will then administer them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the entire head of the patient and apply the plaster to his neck as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And repeat this several times, as it is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the order of those methods I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus, if for those methods healing is good, otherwise make three cauterizations to him in the last part of his head, descending from the higher part of the head to the lower part behind it.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And between each cautery, he should ensure the thickest part of the skin is held, and then carefully perform the cauterization as it progresses.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient tolerates the pain, and the illness permits, perform the cauterization on the middle part of the body; but if greater relief is sought, cauterize both the upper and lower parts.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Ensure the care of what has been healed, and perform the cauterization with olive oil according to the shape previously indicated.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of parasites and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Understand that you should proceed with the softening of the head as we have discussed; then carefully shave the patient's head, and cauterize it in the middle part with a cautery, and cauterize all parts of the head, and cauterize over the last joint of it, and cauterize three times over the spine of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of severe stiffness and pain in the body, and the pain persists, apply four cauterizations on the spine of the back, and later with cautery until the burning sensation of the patient disappears, and raise your hand.

Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized, but that kind of epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, it is important to purify the patient's brain from the beginning of their illness and, for other remedies, as we have mentioned in the previous division when the disease is severe and does not yield to medical treatment.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer liquids and soft foods to them for several days, improving their diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and apply a cautery to it in the middle part of the head as previously described, and another cautery on the back of their head, and over any corners of the head that have been cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then apply cauteries as mentioned, having a paralyzing and softening effect on the body over the spine of the neck and the spine of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And apply the olive cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then apply subtle cauteries according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .xi.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholia.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted by excessive moisture and gross phlegm, cauterize it with the cautery that we have spoken of when it has led to paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess of moisture declining into melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then he should drink water that purifies their brain according to what has been preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, make a decent cut from the hairline down to the circle, and pause it in the middle of the scalp.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should feel relaxed, and be held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; it is more worthy of being done before shearing sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that above the fire for tempering in measure, which causes them to suffer more when placed in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then take that in the middle part of his head in a circular manner, and loosen it within so that it becomes cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week for an entire week, following his diet as mentioned above until he is healed; or if you wish, make small punctures with a carefully arranged cautery, too. This type of cautery moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply that warm compress on the edges or in the form of a cloth made from lupine.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	About the treatment of water retention in the legs.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When the onset of water retention in the legs is indicated by the symptoms previously described in the section, then begin and cause the patient to drink a substance that purges their head, and pay attention to all humidity.

Then command the patient to scrape their head, and cauterize the affected area with a hot iron at the middle of the head; and cauterize twice with two irons over two temples if it is the onset of water retention in both legs, or on one side if it is the onset in one leg.

E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flows when cauterizing; and if you see blood flow from it, stop any further medication that is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And come to knowledge that is derived from arteries and amputation of those, and caution against blood flows.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes, the cervical region is cauterized between two bones using two cauterizing instruments.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When eye tears are ancient and frequent, and through veins and arteries in the manifest location of the head outside, it is verified that this is a sign of fluid excess, tighten the fleckmatique muscles, cauterize that which we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of hot water in the eyes, cauterize in the middle part of the head, and two cauteries below the temples, and two cauteries below the cervix between two bones.
