E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And this is done at times, and then the place is restored using drying and astringent agents.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	So if the place is consolidated and there is good flesh around it, and the body parts are separated from the sound and healthy ones for forty days, and it is not renewed or inflamed or affected by any accidents, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	If that is not the case, then it is not about widening the fissure but reducing it to its natural shape, and according to this manner: and it is that you expose the bone according to the cut or acute medicine, and once the bone is exposed, you take hold according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the end of the instrument be triangular, and the shaft of the instrument be first extended within the extremity thus with several turns.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	Then place your hand over it, and that is the part of the lacrimal; extend your hand a little from the side, and then rotate your hand on the surface until it penetrates all the bone, and you will feel the pain as it seeks to escape from there when you remove your hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Therefore, you will now restore the area with astringent medicines that have been prepared.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Therefore, when the flesh is no longer infected and the place is hardened, the matter that had escaped from the openings returns to the body, so this is less severe on the illness.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	For the reduction of the hernia's protrusion.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the hernia protrudes completely and does not occur due to strain or discomfort, it is necessary to relax the patient, then continue with the following: make incisions in the neck for drainage and suction; apply a liniment to the hernia made of alder, aloe, yarrow, and snake root, and tighten the bandage over the hernia with powdered motes.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the way of the powder is to take linen cloth with many threads, and each cloth should be folded in four parts; make these threads into powder.

De curacio de alconati.	**On the Healing of Alconati** (or "Eye Diseases")
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness called alconati is not, as it seems, a sane condition that adjusts itself like water flowing downward and it is not that one.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	The manner of working in this case is that you cease the illness upon its appearance on the affected part and right away, and then take hold of its head with both your hands from two different directions, and press it so that you prevent the health from spreading to other parts, and keep it thus, and stop the flow of liquid, and the illness will see its causes in this way as it observes.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not flow down, you know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	If the flow of health is not prepared for descent as we have said, then stop the illness between your hands and take a fine needle and pierce it into that surrounding the panniculus, just before the continuation of the conjunctiva with the tunica cornea in the crown (at the desired location), until the health is drained out.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Therefore, when it is removed, you will distill the warm water that you have mixed with honey or water in which fennel and honey have been boiled.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then it is cured as the other causes are treated, so that it is healed.

De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of water coming from the throat.

Frequent sightings of a growth on the tips of the nose, which initially appears small but significantly grows over some days, warrant close observation to determine its nature.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason, you should pay close attention from the moment you notice its beginning appearance and eradicate it completely.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then apply the cautery or medicine that burns over the area where it is located.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If the operation takes too long, it should be hurried, considering whether it is enlarged, hard, of dark color and with little sensation, then do not touch that part which is infected with gangrene; for signs indicate that this gangrene brings great harm to whoever suffers from it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the gangrene is of a bright red color and not dark, and it is possible to operate in all parts, then evacuate the infection and cut away the affected part without delay, and treat the area with something that draws out and constricts the pus until it heals.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	On the stitching of the nose, lips, and earlobe when continuity is broken due to a wound or similar.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You should know that when a rupture of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, it causes little effect on the operation in some people.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	So, when you encounter any cause related to those, considering it a fresh wound or an old one, and then you adjust the two edges of the wound with stitches, and subsequently care for that area until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the edges of the rupture are already separated and each part is healthy, then you should extract any foreign body from its place ensuring that it doesn't cause infection.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you adjust the two edges with stitches and strengthen them, and sprinkle dragon's blood and trissat on them, and place a piece of fine plaster or some other consolidative dressing over that powder, leaving it for two days or three, and then remove that and replace the plaster and leave it until the wounds are completely healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The technique of stitching is that you add the solution for continuity or use needles as we have recommended in the stitching of the abdomen, or add the solution for continuity with silk as it has been explained to you.
Capitol .xxvii.	**Capitol XXVII.**
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Regarding the extraction of those causes that occur in both lips during internal divisions.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	You often observe various individuals in the internal divisions of their lips, some have hard apothems resembling the fat of errors, and others are smaller or larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you should manipulate the lips and openings of each of those hard spots from every direction, and then remove the abscess by cleansing the area with a smooth tool while ensuring that the wound is closed, and afterward, wash it with wine and treat the spot with water that has been heated, so that it heals.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .xxviii.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	On the incision of tissue attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Treatment of the attached gum tissue that ancient practitioners called "albulus": it should be suspended or cut with forceps and incised along its root, allowing the blood to flow or the pus to drain.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then apply over the area a poultice or other stoppers or astringent powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	If the tissue returns, then incise it again secondly and cauterize it, for the cautery should not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter .xxix.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Because of the tooth's pain.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth within and between the gums there are tight, rough, hard cuts, some blackened and some discolored, due to this corruption spreading to the gum, the nearby teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you must open the space between your legs and place the head of the patient in a suitable position, and extract the teeth in which these hard cuts appear, causing a similar feeling as sand, without any pain, and do this until they are all purified from their blackness, whiteness, and other colors.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if this remains as in the beginning of the reason, then it is good; otherwise, you repeat the reasoning to the other parts on the following days and every other day until you reach your final statement regarding what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And you should know that teeth require various types of precise cuts and shapes according to how they are prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	For these reasons, the scissors used to extract a tooth from its socket are different from those used to cut between teeth, and these shapes of scissors must be prepared as you will see shortly:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Eradication of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Understand that you cure the tooth from its pain using all means and take your time in the complete eradication of it, for there is no reason to delay the moment of its extraction, as it is a sublime substance whose excuse lies in the eradication of itself.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	You may also understand that when the patient is compelled to have a tooth eradicated, you must be firmly certain which tooth is causing the pain, as the deceiving pain may come from the illness and not from the healthy teeth, and you eradicate that one, but the pain does not cease until the sick and painful tooth is eradicated, for we have seen this in the operation of the barbies.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, once you have determined which tooth is painful and know its location well, you will need to scrape the area around the tooth with a spatula, ensuring it has some virtue, until it is completely separated from the gums, and then apply pressure with your fingers or use small pliers gradually until it loosens.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	Then apply a strong, firm grip using large pliers or similar tools for good manipulation or extraction, and hold the patient's jaw between your fingers so that it does not move, and treat the tooth according to its position in such a way as not to break it or cause the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if this is not forgotten, take one of those instruments, place it around the tooth from all sides with ease and effort, and attempt its removal as if it had just begun.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or worn down, be careful to wrap cloth around it and stretch it with a fine, sharp wire so that it does not break off when you apply pressure with your pliers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And be careful to perform the scarification precisely in the entire circumference of the gum and keep a firm grip so as not to break or tear it, and return to the patient for further treatment if the pain is greater than the first.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not perform what some ignorant barbers do in their hasty and aggressive attempts at extraction; for these often bring on great misfortunes for men, which are more difficult to treat, and the roots of their teeth become completely torn out or extracted by some bones from the jaw, as we have witnessed with our own eyes.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	Then perform the extraction, washing the mouth with vinegar or salt water.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is pus and it flows for some time, as is often the case with these experiences, scrape a little of this pus and sprinkle it on the wound, and if you do not remove that pus, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The design of the forceps should be fine and delicate, suitable for extracting a tooth from its beginning to the end, with a short handle and thick, so they do not bend when used as intended.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And if they have even thicker handles, the longer you use them, the less likely they are to bend, as their ends are shorter.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	These are made of Indian steel with right-angled ends; at the tips of these forceps, some have teeth that mesh with one another and tighten strongly due to their curved shape, similar to the beak of a wood pigeon, which is very strong.
Capitol .xxxi.	Capital XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and fragments of bone from the crushed jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to extract a tooth that is stuck for any reason, you must place your hand over the area with a border for one or two days until the area is softened; then insert pliers or tongs whose ends are assembled in the shape of a bird's beak called a ciconia or guanta, forming forceps.
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of them shall be done within thus with lime or alum.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not obey these instructions regarding the use of pliers or tongs, then you must lie down and expose all the flesh and insert the instrument whose name is a small lever with this shape:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And the long narrow end should be slightly curved, not too thick, so that it is not trapped.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the incision is incorrectly made, this is; otherwise, help yourself with these other instruments whose forms are as follows: the form of the first instrument is triangular at its end, with some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should be triangular and have a very fine pointed end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And they help with this instrument, having two slopes, the appropriate form of which is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and other instruments which are used for tooth extraction; because gently is done with this instrument resembling a large knife, and its form is:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	from the triangular pointed end, either bent or straight, of any thickness, and not covered so that it is not curved.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing, the extraction instruments for teeth are similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	The skilled and subtle artisans in this art, by observing the patient's condition and various ailments, can determine what is needed for treatment, as the ancient ones did not have a specific tool or form for all kinds of conditions.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the bone of the jaw or any other bone in the mouth is broken, then its weight should be supported in its proper place using instruments and forceps, as we have described for the extraction of teeth, and aid yourself with the gesture that forms this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And if there is any swelling, little by little, and it is tightened or held in the mouth so that it does not burst out or escape until all the bones are completely healed; then restore the area with appropriate medicines for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a small fracture in the bone, then remove any debris from that fracture and clean it, and treat it until it heals.
Capitol .xxxii.	**Chapter .XXXII.**
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	**On the Treatment of Prominent Teeth Among Others.**
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent beyond their natural shape, especially in women and particularly in the most sacred parts, then take care to consider: if one tooth is not properly aligned with another and cannot be corrected or treated, extract it; but if it is not joined to another tooth, then cut it using this instrument that resembles a pig's tusk, made of Indian steel with an extremely sharp point.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And this is your incision tool with which you cut that tooth, over many days due to the hardness of the tooth, and it should not be used on any other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the prominent tooth is exposed for filing, then file it with a file made of Indian steel that has this shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should be entirely made of Indian steel; the edge must be precisely; and it is in the form of needles, or the file should be like needles, with which the tooth is filed little by little over many days with ease, so that no other teeth are damaged.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then tie it at the end, and cut those away with a razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth that is causing the pain and affects the tongue, you must then find a way to clean between the parts that are pressed together so that the tongue is not hurt or the words corrupted.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of lost teeth, it is recommended to use gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens to the front teeth due to a strong blow or removal, and the patient cannot bear it, having tried various medicines, if there is still no improvement, then consider using gold rather than silver wire for tying them together, because silver becomes brittle and may break apart over time, but gold remains unaltered.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the thread should be of such fineness and thickness according to the amount that can fit between the teeth; the form of the filling is to take the thread and wrap it twice around two healthy teeth, and then make it curve in two places between two damaged teeth, or if one or several, until the fabric reaches the healthy tooth of the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the stitching within the opening from which you began, and use your hand with ease and wisdom so as not to damage it further.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And the tension with which you hold the thread must be such that it does not tear the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Then cut the excess thread with forceps or scissors, and place them at various points with gestures, and turn them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so as not to injure the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then he should tie it up so tight like a Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	If it becomes loose or ruptures, tighten it or those parts with another firm hold in such a manner constantly.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two bad ones, thus when these ligatures are done:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it is done so that a tooth or two returns to their proper place in each location and they grow back as we have recommended, they remain firm.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only skilled artisans and wise ones do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a cause from the bones of a cow is shaped like a tooth and placed in the spot where the tooth is missing, it is tightened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Capitol .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Regarding the incision of the ligament visible on the tongue, prevent its movement.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament, which is visible on the tongue, sometimes occurs naturally or it may be a result of an accident due to a condition that has already become established.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is to open the mouth of the malunion, freeing its top from the lower jaw; then lift the tongue and make an incision in that nervous ligament according to its extent so that the tongue can be separated from its attachment.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	If there is any hardness or resistance and this has become established due to a condition, then you apply oil and cut it according to its extent until the ligament is incised and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to cause a fissure in the flesh and cut here behind, allowing pus to flow out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then clean the incision site with warm water or wine or fricative water; and leave the tongue relaxed; it is beneficial for the patient to keep the tongue outside during the night so that it does not solidify again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	If a flow of pus occurs, apply vinegar to the site; if the pain is severe, use a cautery with a poisonous substance suitable for it.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that treatment for the other causes as long as it heals.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On extraction of the ranula, leave the tongue aside.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, the tongue becomes abscessed and resembles a small stone, preventing the tongue from performing its natural function; and when it swells greatly, it is magnified to such an extent that it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on them is to open the mouth of the hernia, looking at it directly in front of the sun and considering the aperture.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see that it is of a dark, hard color, from which the hernia does not feel pain, then do not touch that part which is cracking.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it turns to white, in which there is humidity, then insert your finger into it, and cut with a delicate spatula, and divide it entirely; and if you have strong wind during the time of your operation, then place a piece of cloth over it, tightly bound, as long as the pain persists.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have completely treated it, after having washed it with wine and salt; and take care of the other healing remedies for it until it is cured.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter .xxxvi.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of abscesses from two ears and that which is nothing in the throat, and other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess forms in the throat, there are glands that are tightly packed together, which break outside and are called two ears, which, when you treat them as mentioned in the previous section, and they do not heal, then consider if the abscess is hard, of a dark color, with little sensation, and do not touch it with a knife.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red color and the base is thick, then do not touch it with a knife due to the pus; instead, let it mature as it is, and either it will be drained on its own or it will break open by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, soft, and the base is thin, then that needs to be cut into.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, before your operation, if the abscess in him has rested with complete rest or has been reduced in any way; and then stop the disease before the sun, and let his head be in the low position, open his mouth, and the servant takes between his fingers the tongue of him gently with a noble instrument of which this is the shape.
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or brass, and be subtle with a blade.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press on the tongue and show the abscess to your patient, and see that his teeth are loose over that place, then take pliers and hold that in the amen (or groove) and pull that into the parts outside as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that you pull out is the cause of the tunic, and then you cut into it with an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It resembles a pair of pincers, yet its extremities are curved, so the sharp points of each are in the opposite direction, one on top of the other, both made of iron but coated.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this instrument is not available, cut a blade with the shape of this: sharp on one side, blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And having cut one slice, cut another in the same manner, and then close the wound with hot water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, cleanse it with water from the decoction of chamomile or mistletoe and similar herbs until the flow of blood stops, and then treat that wound so that it heals.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And in some cases, there are other appendices close to those two ears, and you should cut them as you have said in the incision of two equal slices.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And you have already treated a woman with gangrene who was born in the sole of her foot, whose gangrene tended to a dark color, with little feeling, which had closed the sole of her foot, and the woman breathed heavily, and she had forbidden herself food and drinking water, and she would have died if more time had passed for one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the gangrene had already infected so deeply that it had formed two abscesses, which would drain through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So you should listen to them fistula-wise and stay in one of their rooms, remove that one, and throw it away, take a large portion of them, and then you should incise the one from which you understood the other wound, and then you should press on its mouth, grasp its tongue, and then stay with the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then you should remove a large piece of it, and there was little or no bleeding from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, it is absolutely essential for that woman, and soon after drinking water, they should also take food, so you must not continue to cut those motas of the wound for a long time, and successive wounds in place of that one, which incision persists as long as it continues.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore, you must wash and dress the wound, and thus add to it; and then you should walk and not know that God has done so much for that very person.
Capitol .xxxvii.	**Capitol .xxxvii.** (This indicates the title or heading of a specific chapter or section.)
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On incision of the hernia when it becomes infected.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When catarrh occurs in the hernia, and it becomes infected and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is at the opening thin and round, then it is called a bubble.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When the condition we described in the previous section has been cured and you do not observe any improvement, and it turns out that the abscess has already formed and is very small, then you should know that you need to incise those that are enlarged; but if it is of a considerable length, and is bloody, of a dark color or black, and does not give way to treatment, then be wary of making an incision, for there is great danger in this case.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you observe that according to the method I have described, in its whiteness and length, the disease is removed and you press the tongue of it with an instrument that shapes its form, then reduce the hernia, pull it down and make an incision with one of two instruments used for the operation of two incisions.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And be aware that you should not make an incision except in a place that is suitable according to the natural course of the disease, for if you make an incision too much, you will harm its healing.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then make the incision, using what we have recommended in the incision of two wounds, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient was frightened by the incision and saw the cautery as dangerous, know that the cautery is nothing but hot water, and this is how you should proceed: hold the patient's head firmly in place, press the tongue with the instrument we mentioned, take water as described in the chapter on cauterization, create a strong flow of live steam, and apply it not too thick or too thin, filling the concave shape of the instrument.
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The end of the instrument should be concave, where the medicine is placed, just like a spoon's curve, and place the instrument with the medicine on top of the wound. The patient should lie on their back so that saliva or mucus from their mouth comes into contact with the intrinsic medicine, preventing any further damage to the throat and healing it.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then apply your hand to the medicine, and extract it from the uvula by making a space of a moment until you see that it is degraded and soothed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take care and wrap that around the end of the ray, immerse the wrap in the medicine, insert the ray into the wrap through a channel above so that the wrap adheres to that channel, and do this several times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, then let it dry so that it falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and then clean the cauterization on the uvula by wiping it with a cloth soaked in the medicine, wash it thoroughly with warm water, apply an external embrocation, and use poultices until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this specific method of treatment is both safe and free from fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with something that is finer than a cautery and incision, as it is treated by sublimation in this manner: take calament, hyssop, origan, rue, scened arabic, chamomile, broad and similar herbs to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes or some of them in one mixture, and submerge them with wine; let them bubble; and the wave should be well struck against a decently placed tray, on which a pointed instrument of wood or metal is placed according to this manner; it should be made of silver or brass.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And then the end of the instrument is inserted into the patient's mouth, allowing the vapor to rise to the uvula, until the uvula becomes significantly obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this process on the affected areas until they are dry, and be careful not to perform this treatment while food is present, as it might excessively irritate the hernia, and you should not do that unless a doctor has examined and declared the hernia.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If you do not have this tool at hand, take a cane and attach a ring of iron to its end, so that the opening of the wound is sealed, as the iron ring prevents vapors from burning the wound.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On removal of thorns and other substances adhering to the skin, and on other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Various things adhere to the skin, or thorns from feet, or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	So then, when you have removed what is apparent from these things, upon which the eye looks, and pressed your tongue against the tool in front of you, so that what is in the mouth becomes clear to you.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And for what is hidden from your sight in the gullet, be sure to make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for the strong cause annexed to the gullet will be forgotten through vomiting; or that the patient swallows a piece of nap or chopped lettuce or a bite of dry bread; or take a piece of dried sea sponge, tie it tightly with string, and make the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where there are thorns and it is extracted, then it will be forgotten.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And you can take a eel and tie gallstones to it, then immerse it in hot water and extract them; or take a pear, peel it, and soak the seeds and extract them.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If these causes are not forgotten, then use an instrument of lead in the following manner:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be sharp, thick, and slightly curved; at the tip, there is a hollow which you will insert into the patient's mouth with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And he raises his head and be careful that you feel the touch of his bone in his throat, so that he may take in air and alleviate the pain caused by the bone or the spine, or what the doctor puts in his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	Although the illness may seem better, because of his knowledge of the place where the cause is attached and he drives it down and applies his hand with the instrument to it, according to the amount that has been prepared for him, until it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	**Chapter XXXIX**
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of the blood clot attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treating the blood clot as we have discussed in the division of treatment by medicines and not with surgery, consider the throat of the patient under the sun, since you will have to remove his tongue with the instrument that we recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you examine the blood, extract that small or subtly shaped clot appropriately.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	If it is not possible to extract the clot, then take a concave needle and insert it into the wound of the patient, and in the concavity of the needle, place a heated iron, and do this several times (as long as the blood stops flowing and the clot is removed from the wound) and keep the patient on water for the rest of the day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a vessel filled with water, apply its mouth to the wound, and wash the wound with it; do not spill any of the water and change it every hour for now until the blood stops absorbing the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	If we have not forgotten what has been recommended, then fumigate the patient on the head or with an herb-infused smoke using the instruments designed for suffocating the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so it falls where it should.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another method of operation through suffocation of that part is that you take a cloth in which there are ignited coals and cover it with a covering in the middle of which is an opening, and place the extremity of the instrument on that opening; then apply the suffocation to the patient; and have the patient open his mouth at the end of the tube, and close his lips so that the suffocation is not discharged until you know that the suffocation has reached the bloodstream, because the blood will soon come.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if he does not eat, you repeat the suffocation with motive vapor again and forbid the patient from drinking, and eating salty foods, and drinking water, and it is also necessary that this regimen be followed until.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument used to draw blood from the veins when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as well, except that it has no curve in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed in the throat, and its end resembles a cicada's beak, which is curved, and it sticks to anything it touches, that's why, when we encounter any cause, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the entire discourse is focused on the diagnosis and treatment of apoplexy.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Apoplexies are special symptoms, of various kinds, as we recall them from this book, each with its own characteristics.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their perforation and section in two ways: one is for the specific type of apoplexy itself; and also for what we understand about humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is specifically for the places where bodily accidents occur, because the apoplexy that occurs in the head is different from the apoplexy that occurs in the legs; and the apoplexy in the fleshy parts is different from the one in the joints; and each of them has its own treatment through operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And some ulcers are such that they do not need to be drained but rather the maturation of the wound in those or completion of their course.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other types of ulcers are such that they need to be drained when they become crossed, and do not mature according to their course. Similarly, with ulcers that are inclined towards joints, an ulcer forms near a joint, the condition of it prolongs until you can observe something in the circulation of the blood, and its intensity corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, leading to contraction of that member; or if it is close to a major limb, and you delay the perforation beyond its maturation, it will affect the main limb; or it is near the buttocks, so you must perforate one that is not yet matured; and do not perforate it while still in its raw state, otherwise, it may cause the pus to escape and extend beyond the buttocks, creating a fistula, or something formed at the end of its course, which will not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is also important to know the time for draining the ulcer, as it should be done when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you will know that recovery has begun when the pain ceases and fever abates, and there is a reduction in rigidity and pulse, and the redness of the affected area becomes less pronounced, as well as other symptoms.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And be aware that you should know how to make an incision in the location of the pus, left by the abscess, and also coming from the healing of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	This incision is always made through the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the thighs or feet, and in places of the glands, nerves' cords, arteries; and finally, in any location that does not reflect, for in those that do reflect, one should use incision according to that particular member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, then it is better to avoid making the incision until the digestion of it is confirmed according to what we have said; for if you make the incision there before, it prolongs the course of the disease and increases the pain and hardness of its edges, and deepens its wound.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	You may make some incisions in certain places through the thickness of the flesh or body parts as needed, or according to what the affected member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And be aware that you should administer small incisions, and in large apothemas make deep and wide cuts or sections according to the diversity of the size of the apothemas.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other types of apothemas where it is necessary to reduce and incise the swelling, when such a pain occurs as if it were in a pan and is made in such a way that it already stands firm, so with those who suffer from double or bubonic fever.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And regarding those who are incised in a section with three angles, and of those where it is incised just as the figure of a myrtle leaf, so too with the apothemas of the knees.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And regarding their type where a round section and lunar section are administered, they resemble those mentioned above.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	May he who has no such issue with superficial wounds, be sure to pierce with a shallow or flat needle only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And if the wound is deep and has already collected a lot of pus, do not pierce it at once; instead, extract some of the pus, then pack the wound tightly the next day, and extract more pus in subsequent visits, increasing the amount gradually as it is discharged.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And most especially if the patient is a frail woman, or an old person, or a young child, as the animal spirit's vital force tends to resolve towards the exit of the wound, and they often die from the operation.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Take great care with this chapter: when you perform the piercing for these wounds, be sure to cleanse them and consider whether the wound of the apostema is shallow or deep; if it is shallow, then administer the appropriate remedies; but if it is deep, and the openings from the piercing are wide, you must apply pressure to each opening until they close together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If, in the abscess, a part of the cord or a concave space in the ring is separated, then cover it with a thin piece of cloth or thread from linen, as when you treat cuts or razor wounds, apply moisture; tighten that area within three days; and subsequently treat and cure it with poultices until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If, during your operation, there is a flow of blood, you should administer clean water and mix it with cloth, and place that over the area where the bleeding occurs, pressing it gently.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding persists, you must administer remedies and treatments, and apply powders recommended in various places of this our text and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is during winter, and the area of the abscess is full of nerves, you must wrap poultices in hot oil and place them on the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the parts are fleshy, then cover that you place powder soaked in water and oil or wine and oil, and all of this be rubbed until it is the third day, as we have said, and then cover that you loosen the blister and cleanse it and apply what is appropriate for its healing until it is cured.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the healing of blisters universally, more so according to the method of distinction I have already said about each blister in which way it is a path to its cure, by chapters separately.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xl.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of blisters which appear on the nape of the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the nape of the neck, there are small blisters, which are of various types with layers that are made of them; and these are called by different names.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from these come drops, and those contain a humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those that contain humidity similar to sweat, and resemble them; and those that are rocky, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those [humors], there is no fear, as the incision of those should not cause any hostility.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you expect those to be received by an instrument in the shape of which they are, which is called a trocar, as long as you know it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what contains is humidity, then you split that as section according to length by sectioning superficially in this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And it begins in the section of the line B within the line G. Thus, as the moisture is evacuated, you scrape that through which that moisture passed, and do not leave any cause for it, for troops seen returning may indicate some cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then immerse the affected area in hot Egyptian (possibly referring to a medicinal bath) or, if not available, in water and salt; fill it with that remedy and leave it for another day, as it corrodes all that is broken off from that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Then you repeat the application of that remedy with hot Egyptian (medicinal) bath according to need, as long as you are confident there is no other cause for that skin condition; cure the affliction with the remedy until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess with fatty nodes, then you insert into it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	I have a section without the shape of a cross, and make an incision between two folds of the section and tear it from top to bottom, and use your virtue to extract the tunic that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If it causes resistance in your arc (or instrument), then do what I have told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, treat the abscess of the section with cauterization according to what I have told you; the incision over the abscess that has been cauterized is lighter, as it is of little pain and has little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are certain abscesses of these types that are in the head, on some men, where there is no humidity at all; which causes because you have incised an abscess on the head of an old woman and left it with a hard, sour, white stone that could not be drunk, and if anyone were to touch it, they would be infected.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	In other cases of accidents on the head, except for these, this chapter does not apply, thus the section for all these should be a superficial one.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And stop the perforation of those in the lower part of their origin so that the matter of the disease is alleviated from the deeper parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then apply care to those as it suits the treatment of that one.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulas that occur on the collarbone.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Various cases of these abscesses occur on the collarbone, armpits, and angles; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And so those that occur in the gut, and so motes that are generated within them, and all scrofula of those comes from their own tunic, and thus also with the nodes and apoplexy of the head, as we have mentioned.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofulas are motes; some are stone-like, others contain moisture, and those that do not obey treatment are malicious.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.
