Therefore, in the case where you perceive a good disposition for treatment, of which the color is peculiar to that of the ulcer, and it is painful at all points, not attached to any nerves or veins or tendons, and not swollen, you must incise it along the dry surface of the wound from the edge of the body towards the center of the line G, beyond the line B, remove it entirely from the part, and extract the edges of the ulcer with tweezers, if necessary, as we have mentioned regarding the apoplexy of the head; you must do so little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it requires more caution that neither the vein nor nerve be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And the knife should not be too sharp, nor should it suit your hand for cutting, or inquiet the patient, and you should not cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery, it would prohibit your operation, then the disease would become more severe with vitriol or other powders that stop the flow of pus, and make the plague worse, and leave that which prevents the healing of the fistula and softens the plague, and begins to be putrefied.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the pus is drained.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until it is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then carefully examine the said indicated area if there is any cause of the other small scrofulas; therefore, cut and clean those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it concerns a large vein in the region of the scrofula, you must be careful not to puncture that scrofula from its origin.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Be careful not to force the broken thread, as it may fall out on its own.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with fresh gauze that you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and tend to it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	If you puncture the scrofula completely, be careful to close both edges of the wound and apply a poultice immediately to prevent any excessive discharge of pus.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	If you notice excessive discharge due to the size of the scrofula, be sure to understand where it originates, and carefully puncture its origin. Then drain it and apply a suture as well as the treatment mentioned above.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrofulas that contain humidity, make a superficial perforation at the place where you see the formation of it, and stop the perforation when the pus is drained from the lower parts of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation, using some ointment and similar things to that which corrodes what is broken down by corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then, when you see the wound has healed, you apply a treatment made from generative flesh ointment until it is completely cured.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XXXIII
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On section of the pilon (bone) of an apoplexy (stroke or sudden loss of blood flow to the brain), take care during the operation.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients performed this section in the pilon, and we have not seen anyone in our land who can do such a thing.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of these ones.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In some men, there is a weakness, and the extraction of the stone must be avoided, because by doing so, all the veins and the major ones of the disease are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have abscesses in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the illness is not in the teeth, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of stones to prevent loss, which is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, cut the stone below three circles of the circles of the stone, or four with a small section due to the thickness in that which is between two circles for quantity, and the section should be on the bone, not on the cartilage, and this location is suitable for cutting because it is devoid of flesh and the blood vessels of the stone are open.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is cautious, you must ensure that he extends the chain of the scalpel to an angle, and then cut the chain until it reaches the channel, but avoid the blood vessels if they get in the way for any reason.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then, insert the blades according to our recommendation; this refers to the section of the channel for the flux that is caused by this condition, which is broken off and removed through the incision.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	So when the hour arrives that the piercing is to be made, add two layers of the scalpel's edge to the wound, and with this single one, cut through the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then, administer medicines that promote healing of the flesh until it is cured.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the essence of our discourse, which we have collected, is to observe that some of these spots have already weighed down the patient's condition, and the disease has spread throughout the body, and its air is cut off, and some go to incise the epiglot so that the patient breathes on the spot of the wound through some respiration, and thus is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this, I will order the wound to remain open until the evil of the disease is consumed; and the evil of it is for three days; and therefore, you shall command the wound thus, and heal it until it is sane.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen for myself, is that a servant used a knife and scalpel to cut into the patient's chest, incising a part of the lung, and I was called to treat him, and I observed the breathing as if from a dying person, and I uncovered the wound, and treated the scar left by the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, you must admit that he did not cut either a vein or an artery, and the breath still comes from the plague; he treated it with fire until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And do not cut the servant unless it is necessary in your voice; after a few days, return to the improvement of their conditions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epiglottis, there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter .xliv. (This appears to be a chapter number, indicating the beginning of a new section or topic in the medical treatise.)
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section concerning the abscess that occurs outside the throat, which is called a hernia of the throat.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess, called hernia of the throat, is a great abscess according to the color of the body, and it occurs more in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And there are two manners of it, either natural or accidental.

And the accidental is according to two manners; in one it is similar to gouty nodules, and the other manner is similar to apoplexy which is caused by the congestion of an artery, and that is fearful.

And then you should examine it and investigate it as he has said, and if it appears similar to gouty nodules, and is not suspended from any vein, you incise it thus with the nodules, and extract that which causes it from within the flesh and bursae; otherwise, you should scrutinize its whole being, and tend to the place in need of cure until it is healed.

De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the section of nodes' species.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the sectioning of abscesses that occur through arrow wounds or veins.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor. E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is due to a vein returns to the visible sign of the body.

Then take the needle and make it penetrate between these two parts, and tighten the tendon with a double thread in two places, which will cause the patient to excrete from two tendons located in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then apply the pressure to the area between two ligaments using a spatula until the pain disappears completely, and the swelling is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then administer treatment where pus is formed until the ligaments fall, and care for it with suitable ointments until it heals.

If the abscess is caused by a cut vein, then you must cover your hand over the area to your best ability near the abscess at the back of the limb, and insert the needle into the spot where you have placed your hand, penetrating it; then make it enter in a double thread until you extract it from the other side, and tie the abscess with a suitable ligament as I have previously mentioned regarding the uva4 ligament on both sides of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that the thread might break, insert the needle into the remaining aperture, following the path of the first cut, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the aperture in the middle of it, while it is still fresh, and then incise the excess of the thread, leaving what is attached to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place a poultice on it which you have soaked in wine and oil, and administer the treatment which is necessary to heal it.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Cap the aperture which occurs due to the twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Thus, when an aperture occurs in the rear and in the veins, and appears to be caused by nerve apertures when they are struck or occur due to excessive work, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And the most of it is done in the places of the assistants or the foot, or in any place where the joints are afflicted.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe ulcer, resembling the color of another body, and it appears in its most vulnerable parts; when it is narrowed by intense violence, the patient feels a pain resembling stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an ulcer that occurs in the front or back of the body; for this reason, the patient remains bound, and the pain afflicts the entire limb without moving to other parts.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, concerning those who have pain in the joints, it is not necessary to be cut with a knife, for they will naturally experience contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	One should bind those who have pain in the head or forehead with a cloth.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If it is a small abscess, cut it open with scissors and sever that part from its root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then open it with a knife, cut it out, and close it up; and secure the wound with stitches, and treat it until it heals.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the cure of hernia (or "eminence" of the navel).
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The hernia (or eminence) of the navel is caused by various reasons: either due to fissures in the abdominal wall, from which emerges the intestine or hernia, as is the case with other ruptures; or because of a leak of blood or lymph fluid (sanct), as described above; or because of excessive flatulence confined within.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is due to an abdominal wall fissure and the protrusion of the hernia, then the appearance of the hernia is similar in color to that of the body; and it causes a sharp pain, and appears in various positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is for the exit of the hernia, you must pay attention to the position of that mass which we have described, with greater diversity, and when you press on that mass, it becomes concealed, then return; and it strongly pushes into its own place, and it is glorified by a great deal of heat and vigorous work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to humidity, you will feel a warmth and not occlusion when pressing with your hand, nor constriction or pain.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to infection, then these symptoms will appear as a black, declining abscess.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is not due to flesh, then the abscess is severe, thick and hard, and it accumulates according to a certain amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to windiness, then the touch of it feels hot.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider when the prominence of the navel is due to a hernia, or a vein, or from gas; then you must be prohibited from treating it, for there is fear and danger as it is taught in the chapter where I have discussed hernias by arteria and vena.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to an intestine or hernia, then you must order the patient to lie still, and gently apply pressure around the entire navel; then insert a thin instrument in the circle of the navel at the place where you have felt the indentation, and extend the extent of the hernia above it with a large finger; and then encircle the area with a strong thread or catgut, and tie it tightly.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then, you should break the wall of the hernia over the ligament and insert your finger into that opening to explore the intestine; if it is stuck or held back by the ligament, then carefully extract it and push the intestine back inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the affected area, take some ointment; and cut away the excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	If it is against your practice or vein, then circle that part and return to your operation; and take two needles and insert them into those two strong threads and pass two needles through the loop which you have made around the abscess in a crosswise manner, which will make them penetrate; and then tighten the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, leave the needles and let the location heal until the flesh is extended and falls off by itself; or cut it when it has subsided and becomes curable, and then treat it with something that covers the wound until it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the bulge of the navel is due to flesh or moisture, then cover the abscess as we have said and remove the pus or moisture which you find in it, and then treat it with something that covers and strengthens the area.

De curacio de cranc.	On the cure of cracks.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu. We also spoke about the causes of cracks and precautions to be taken in their cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	The ancient ones said that sometimes cracks appear in places where it is possible to completely eradicate them, such as the crack which is on the breasts or on the thigh, and similar ones on other parts of the body, by removing everything around it, especially when it has just begun and is small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and deep, it may not be curable on its own, for I have neither seen nor heard of any remedy that has succeeded in such cases.

And the operation on it is as we have said, you must precede and remove the disease and purge it of black cholera in several instances, and then drain that, if a manifest filling is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient for the operation in the preparation that is placed there; and carefully cut around it, covering all parts with a good cloth for further protection so as not to cause any damage to the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, but do not abruptly stop it; press on the spots, and with your hand or an instrument that is at your disposal from among the available tools, extract the thick blood.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	If it is against your will to make a thick blood clot cut of a vein or an artery, cauterize that until the flow of blood stops, and then take care of it with the other remedies until it heals.

De curacio de ydropici.	On the cure of hydrops.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already discussed, in the previous section, the types of hydrops and the signs of each, as well as their treatment with medicines.

E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And be sure that your incision is on the side where the malady wishes to flow, so as not to cause excessive effusion at that place.

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	It resembles a fine silver tube; it is made of silver or bronze or iron, and in its opening there is a small hole, and on its sides there are three holes: two from one side and one from the other; and its end is cut according to the shape of a pen, thus:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the end of it there is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, the ring will immediately adhere to the instrument, thus evacuating a considerable amount of water in one go; for if you evacuate less than necessary in one attempt, the patient's condition may worsen due to the resolution of their animal spirit, or they may suffer a heart attack that is close to death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	You should evacuate according to the amount that is necessary, based on your understanding of the patient's condition, the strength of their vital spirit, and the benevolence of the treatment.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra. And on the following days, if the patient tolerates it, repeat the procedure and extract a small amount of water each time, doing so for several days with caution, and avoid errors as not to empty all the water at once.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat. E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And treat it with the other remedies until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	If there is a need for bloodletting, administer cauteries monthly according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Where a cautery is beneficial for two purposes, it aids at once in the flow of blood and in the healing of a corrupt ulcer.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the foreskin is corroded and destroyed completely at that moment, you must insert a platinum cannula into the inside of the foreskin so that the infection urinates through that opening.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion occurs only in those whose foreskin is its own, and no circumcision is required; and when adhesion occurs due to an ulcer or abscess), you must carefully cut away with an obtuse spatula until the adhesive substance is dissolved and the head of the penis is completely freed.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them skillfully, you must cut away gently with a spatula from the head of the foreskin and the prepucium itself; this is because when the prepucium is thin, its delicate nature makes it easily perforated.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then carefully separate the prepuce from the head of the penis with a sharp instrument, having previously washed it in water to prevent adhesions in the future.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then, once the fracture is healed, apply a stopping agent within it to ensure its consolidation.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter VII.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the purification of infants and the cure for what happens to those of circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution for continence as with other ailments; however, when it is of our own making and done by our own will, and its practice is indeed beneficial for children, then we should assign to that better operation and method the mildest losses for health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, it is said that the ancients did not practice circumcision in any of their free lands, since they do not write it in their laws, and only because we have acquired by experience the cause for which I have attributed to the greatest number of skilled practitioners and barbers using circumcision and purification with a new knife and with pliers; and they use lint from flax and incisions with a fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And you have already tried all these methods and do not find better relief than with scissors, lances, or thread that, when used to cut the foreskin, force it back, as the foreskin's edge is caught between two layers, and the inner layer is pulled away, requiring another incision and causing certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And the circumcision that is performed by cutting, which surgeons use, is not safe for incising the end of the male member, as it easily enters the wound.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But when using the unglable (forceps), it may break off and corrupt your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of a child is naturally short, and in most cases, it does not require circumcision, and I have seen this myself.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	On the preparation that is done with scissors and linen tape, I have discovered through experience its goodness, because the scissors are of proper incision size, for this reason the sharpness that is above is the same as the sharpness that is below; and therefore when you press your hand with the two sharps, make the cut according to a comparison in time; and it makes compression of the tape in a figure containing the knot of all pain, from which no error arises.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the first manner of the operation is that you keep the child mostly calm if it is one of those who understand a little, do not make any but tie the tape to its hernia only, and let it enter into the other on the following day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make him happy in all possible ways, according to what he understands.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him stay between your hands properly prepared, and do not let him see any scent; hide the scissors in your hand or place the foot so that the child does not see those or any other of the tools.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then insert your hand into the patient's anus and blow into the rectum, pulling it until the tip of the instrument reaches the base of the anus, and clean that which is added to it due to impurity.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	Then secure the site marked with a thread using a small piece of the second ligament, place your finger on it and indicate the position of the ligament left with good tension, and insert between two ligments.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then raise the anus slightly and extract the tip of the instrument; clean the wound thoroughly, which is better, and sprinkle powder on it, then place a cloth on it, in which the mucus from the patient's body is spread with fresh rose oil; leave that over the wound for another day; and treat it with cure until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the forceps used for cleaning, this is the form:

The extremities should not be of unequal length; the others should be so that the axis of the foot does not deviate from the axis of the leg, and both have the same curvature as two handles.

E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your finger, then remove it with a pince and make an incision with that.

If three days have passed and it is believed that the swelling comes from an inflamed aperture, then leave it until the inflammation subsides, extract it with ease, and make an incision according to what you have prepared.

E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And apply treatment to that part as we have said for it to be healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter LVIII.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the cure for retained urine in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by swelling due to stone or congestion, or by a narrow opening or flesh, and similar to those we have mentioned in the methods of treatment in the previous section.

And if the urine is not dissolved and its retention due to pressure already in the bladder's neck, then know that the disease is still bent on its sides.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	Then position the patient's feet on their back and extend their abdomen, pushing it upward from their back; the disease will tighten its grip on the affected area as much as possible.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, the bladder's neck is constricted to facilitate the expulsion of urine from the affected parts behind, so that the urine is voided.

And if the condition we described above does not improve, then you should address the cause of the disease with a syringe, which is called 'siringua'. Its form resembles: both argent and subtle as a lion's claw, equipped with a needle made of fine wire in the shape of a long ray, similar to a palm and a half, with a thin cane at its tip.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the method of urination through that is to take the urethra folded and tied at the end of a thread or string for proper tightening; and insert the ends of the urethra into the opening left by the catheter, and cut it with scissors if any cause for the string is superfluous, but rather insert it forcefully into the canal and then open the bladder with the edge and with urine albumin.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And apply a poultice over the pain on the skin, and drain the vesicle of the patient and the abscess with oils mixed, olive oil and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	Then insert the catheter with ease until it reaches the root of the abscess; and fold the abscess towards the opening of the fistula; and push the catheter from inside; and push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the pain is driven to its origin, and not done according to this order, but rather the meat in which it has twisted.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then carefully extend the lint in the wound little by little, as urine dries out the lint.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that one for the cure of urine, use a catheter, do not stop doing this and use a catheter until the bladder is emptied and the patient finds relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter LIX.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the quality of bladder cleansing with bladder stones and similar instruments that are suitable for this purpose.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When it happens in the bladder, ulceration or abscess, or a severe fistula forms there, and you want to drain water and medicine from it, then use an instrument called a clampstone, and this is how it is done:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But if its beginning is silent, it is tightly closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And there are three parts: two from one side, thus as often.

In the beginning, there is a vacuum, which is what drives it, and according to its quantity, it accumulates or disperses; whenever any cause throws it out of balance due to moisture, it is driven in, and when it is expelled, it is driven out, just as a ship's anchor is affected by the tides at sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra. E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the tip of the anchor into the wound as we have mentioned in the treatment; and drive the moisture away from what you drive, for that moisture reaches the bladder soon enough, and the illness centers around it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The shape of the delicate crystal through which the bladder is crystalized, and that shape is as follows:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	Whether it is made of silver or lead, which looks like a small feather, and leave the stick inside the wound.

Then take the bladder of motion, and place it in the humidity that you want to crystalize in the bladder, and then tie it between two with strong double ligature, and heat that humidity over the fire.

Then apply your hand over the bladder with the humidity, in the manner that the disease requires that that humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas. And then you insert this into the instrument and perform it as you have done with the bladder, expressing with your hand until the moisture reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	**Chapter LXX (60)**
De extraccio de peyra.	**On the Extraction of Stones**
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already discussed the division of stone types and their treatments with medicines, as well as the difference between stones formed in the kidneys and those formed in the bladder, and the signs of each.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have discussed the stone that requires surgical intervention by hand, or sectioning.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone formed in the bladder specifically is the one that becomes lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And they tell you of that most manifest exposition and concise summary.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, it says that the disease originating in the bladder most often affects children; and among its signs, the urine expelled from the bladder is similar to water in its fineness, appearing sandy, and the illness causes itching, swelling, and pain, and this is how it becomes incurable.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the healing of children from that condition becomes easier after they have reached 13 years old; and it is a difficult cure for the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	Among the young, it is more common because of what exists between them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of him whose stone is larger and healing is more difficult; and if it is small, it is the opposite of that one.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, to achieve the cure for this condition, we must begin by cleansing the malady with Christ, who extracts the entire opening present in their intestines; for that opening sometimes hinders the flow of urine due to its inspection.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	Then, taking hold of the hernia near the patient's feet, it should be carefully manipulated and massaged so that the urine descends into the bladder or, sometimes, it may leave its position.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	Then use the appropriate instrument between your fingers, prepared beforehand, and let go of the contents of the bladder, so that it completely empties into the parts below.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	Then, carefully extract everything from that opening, both the solid and liquid matter.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the urine in the space, then immediately cut it open with a knife.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch the slight touch of the tendon, cover it with oil the small indicated part of your left hand, whether the illness is a child or the little seed if it is a young person complete, and insert that into its place.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And then, while the stone is inside, place your small finger there.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And slowly turn that point, little by little, into the opening of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press that place with your small finger, and expel the stone outside from the part you cut it off.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the assistant to press the bladder with his hand; and command another assistant to extend their legs with their right hand above them, and with the other hand hold the cord that is left over the legs in the part where the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then carefully insert a spatulum through the opening which is the shape of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	It divides into what is between the buttocks and genitals, not in the middle place, first on the side of the left thigh; and the incision should be above that bone, and it is said to be in the buttock, and a transverse cut is made, so that the external cut is wide and internal narrow according to the amount that the stone projects from the buttock, not more, because strongly it comprehends the saying that when the stone is in the buttock, the incision should be there, and it is forgotten its disability.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is a stone with angles and edges, so the excretion of it is difficult because of this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And from that, it is like a grain, round, and it is made of the lighter excretion.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that which has angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus easily accessible, cover your hands over that part, or tighten it with a suitable gesture, the extremity of which is as sharp as a stone over which you tighten the bandage on the foot, and do not tear from it; or insert between them an instrument with a curved, fine tip.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	If you cannot do that, then enlarge the wound a little, and if you see blood flow, cut and cauterize it with vitriol three times.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the foot is more than one, at the beginning, push your hand into the opening of the bladder, and cut into it; then push a little water in; and like this, if they seem to be more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the pain is very great, ignorance is that you pierce this great section, because it causes the disease one of two ways: either it stops (the flow) or it promotes the discharge of continuous urine, which is why the location is not entirely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	If it is necessary to expel what is inside that is foreign, or to repair the fracture with pliers, extract those in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, after you have completed your operation, fill the wound with aloe and dragon's blood, and bind it tightly.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place over that cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in warm oil and water, to ensure the poultice gives way gently.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then return the patient to their bed, and do not loosen the bandages for three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that is loosened, moisten the area with water and oil, and then apply a mixture of fine-ground salt and a base of oil until it heals.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	If, in the case of this plague, there is a risk of gangrene, clean and dress the wound, and it resembles a stone frozen in the bladder (and urination is thus hindered), then insert what I am about to say into the plague and extract that pus, for if it causes the bladder to corrupt and putrefy.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with wine, water, and salt, and oppose all kinds of things that are suitable for its cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And during all stages of treatment, ensure that you bind and adjust both things and apply the medicines that are placed on the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and located in the urethra, and it gets stuck there, and urination is blocked, then treat it with something you have recommended before it causes dissection, because the forces used in this treatment are often blamed for causing dissection; take a sharp-pointed iron probe, which is the shape of this one:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular, pointed end, sharp, stuck in the wood.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	Then take a thread, and tie it to the urethra, leaving the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	Then insert the iron into the urethra, penetrating with ease until the probe reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the probe with your hand on the stone, slowly and carefully, and continue drilling until you make a hole from one side to allow urine to flow out; for soon enough the bladder will be emptied.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then apply your hand to what is broken off from the stone of the kidney, outside the urethra, as it is squeezed and expelled with urine, and the disease is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	If this treatment is not suitable for any reason due to that condition, then tie a thread around the stone and another thread on top of it.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	Then tightly compress the stone in that urethra between two closures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract that one.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then release the adhesion and clean the infected gangrenous flesh, which is formed in the ulcer.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to leave a thread around the stone, but only so that it does not return to the bladder; and the other thread on top of it, for when the thread is loosened, the stone is expelled from the urethra, and the infection returns to its place and the disease worsens.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this, it is necessary when you tie the bandage over them, that you raise the edge to the parts above, or that you return to its proper place, and secure the pain thus as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter LXI.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in women are rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	If you see a stone in any of those places, the cure is then difficult, and it is forbidden by many ways.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that women with strong bodies become weary.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you should not find a woman more wise than herself, who would disclose to the doctor when she is pregnant, or whether she is married to a man.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third statement translates as: "The surgeon is he who does not hesitate to perform this art, especially the operation with his hands.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth states: "And in women, the place of incision over the stone is far from the location of the stone, so a deep incision is needed, and there is fear there.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	If it is necessary to do so, you should seek help from a skilled female surgeon, and they are not easily found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	If you are lacking in those skills, seek out a surgeon with sharp and subtle tools, or a female midwife well-versed in women's health, or a woman who has herself undergone this procedure.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	So, command this present one, and tell him to do everything you instruct, from examining the stone to its removal. This is because he must first determine if the woman is a virgin, and ensure that he whispers his words into her ear and asks for the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if you find it, cut it off, leave its root, and then command him to incise on that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	If it is not ripe, then command the midwife to insert her finger into the patient's urinary tract and feel around on the stone, for she places her left hand on the bladder and extracts it at a good price.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, when you find it, slowly extract it from the orifice of the bladder to the outside, at the same time using your strength so that it reaches the root of the matter.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then make an incision at the appropriate place of the urinary tract, from the root of the thigh to some other part, stopping the flow of urine through it and cutting off the stone. His finger should not be withdrawn from the urethra.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And make the incision small at first; then insert the blade into the wound, and if pressure is felt, adjust the incision according to the amount, knowing that the pain will be released from that point.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And you should know that the parts of the kidney are like dots: some are small and sharp, others large and bitter, some long and round, and they have spikes.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know the number of parts (or types) of kidney pain, in accordance with what you have described regarding what you want to address.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	If you wish to stop the flow of blood, apply vitriol (a caustic substance) to the site in three layers and let it sit for an hour until the pain is severed, then return to your operation to ensure that the kidney pain has been released.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare for yourself, from the instruments mentioned in the extraction of kidney stones in men, so that you are aided by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you wish to stop the flow of blood and know that its expulsion is from the arterioles that are cut, then place powder on the area, apply those anti-fever pills and stricture gently, and do not repeat this; leave the stone and do not extract it, for thus the illness will die out.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then treat the plague.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, once the intensity of the bloodletting subsides, after several days, the area may heal. Then you return to your operation until the stone is removed.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the section about hernia removal.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	A hernia of the abdomen is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white chest cavity, which leaves the opening of the vessels containing the bowels, and it is called the chest.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is found in the natural fat that surrounds the liver, which is another organ; and it is the end of the generative power between the white gallbladder that we have spoken of, and this is not true.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness that occurs in the organs, which causes this material to be released, and sometimes it happens due to a blow struck against the organs.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity does not have distinct colors, for the color of it may be declining to citron or bloody, or red, or black and putrid, or white and watery, and it is this that is most important.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is recognized that this addition of water has occurred are as follows: for if it is in the white gallbladder that we have spoken of, then the appendage becomes round and slightly elongated in length with a shape like a pear, and the organ appears, because the humidity surrounds it from all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	If the humidity is in the own panicle, then the abscess becomes red from the wound and thus man thinks it is another wound.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the legs of the genitals and the white ciphas (testes), then a burning sensation occurs.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And to determine the color of the humidity, you should observe the color of the abscess as it appears from the wound's edge; and according to what is seen in the track of the wound, judge what is within.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the treatment of it with iron, you should know that you command the patient to be fleabitten if possible, and clean the wound thoroughly.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	Then, lie the patient on their back for some time due to any cause and place clean cloth under them.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then place yourself on the patient's left side, and instruct the assistant to follow his right side, who should stretch his leg from one to two spans from the knee to the buttocks and to the opening of the abdomen.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	Then take a long, sharp knife and cut the inguinal ligament in the middle of its length near the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And make the incision according to the direction of the hair growth, at a distance from the line that you must follow with the knife, so as to reach the white bone inside.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And then extract it, observe, and pay attention so that you do not incise; your incision should be made with precision, carefully examining the amount of extraction at every step.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	Then punch the white bone with a wide puncture and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate the two lips of the incision with scissors, extend the blade along the edges; do not touch the wound with your fingers, and cut the blade in that way that is within your ability.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut through it completely or in pieces, especially its thin edges, for if you do not examine the incision of it carefully, there is a risk that the water does not drain out.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if you process it from outside the wound during your operation, then once you have completed the incision of the blade, return inside and adjust the two lips of the wound of the genitals with sutures, and then treat it just as you do with other injuries, as long as it heals.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find that it is corrupted by another illness, then grasp the vessels that are above the suspension, extract the water, and treat it as we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	If water is added in two parts equally, you will know that both are hernias; therefore, incise that part as you did the other in contrast; and if it seems to be an operation to you, then do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you should clean the wound, and enter into the sections of the infected skin immersed in oil or rose oil; place another piece of cloth immersed in wine and oil, expanding it over both genitals and the miracle of the belly; and place them on folded sheets and poultices, and bind these with the bandage according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	Then take two sheets of cloth and make them humid with warm water; press the extremities where it is held by the cord or damp wool, add them to the structure in the crotch of the pants, one extremity taking the place of the anus between the two, and the second touching the fold of the thigh, and all the tightness should be adjusted in the crotch of the pants.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases, this hernia is treated artificially with cautery instead of cutting with iron; so you take a delicate cut-wound cautery and incise at the root of the intestines, and light it according to what we have recommended until the white cips containing the water becomes uncovered, and then you take the cautery in this manner:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it resembles Greek script.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then perforate that cips, and light it until all the moisture is drained out.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the cips with cuts, and scrape it with delicate cautery lit, incising it according to your ability until everything is eradicated, and be careful that the fire does not touch you.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And you know that this operation is much safer and further from the flow of pus compared to cutting.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	If it causes you discomfort to use cautery during incision or heating, or if there is bleeding, then be sure to treat the difficulty that afflicts you with a cure appropriate for it as described above.

If the patient is in great pain and there is no hope for a second operation due to its terrible nature, then perforation should be administered as we have recommended; and it is at this point, as we have mentioned regarding the meanings, that you will know that this hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Now you know that you must cut the malady on a raised spot, then perforate the abscess at the lowest part of it with a wide spatula, and pause the perforation according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And it should be wide enough to let all the water flow out.

If there is any contraindication to the discharge of water at that time when you perforate it: this should only be done if the white pannicle in the orifice of the plague causes discomfort and prevents the emission of water, then know that you must insert into the plague a needle or instrument with which the water is extracted from the dropsy, whose form is preceded; or apply a small amount to the size of the plague.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And you should know that the water returns and is retained for about five or seven months; and when it is added, then it should be perforated in the same manner as before, so that the disease will also pass its days.

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	On Hernia (Fatty) and its Treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the incision above this hernia, there is great danger of losing the best dispositions; for it seems to me that its discharge and being saved is through that better way.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you should remember the operation on that one and the use of the poultices.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, it is said that the apostemas appear in the bodies of those whose genera are composed in such a way, and this is done for various reasons: either due to an acute excess of humors that overflow into the genera, or through percussion.
