The sign of this, when it is an extension of the abdominal wall, is that it occurs gradually over a long time, and not suddenly, and it is a protrusion of the abdomen towards the back due to the abdominal wall pushing against the intestine.

De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias. E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore it is said that castration is performed in two ways: either by tying or by cutting an opening with a section.

Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis. De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the treatment of fistulas that tend to form.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida. And if you do not feel that at all or if you do not find any cause of expulsion such as worms or flatulence, as we have said, then you know it is non-penetrant, and now you must limit yourself to treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the tissue of the penis, then the meaning of it is the emission of urine from that place and its prohibition until that location is strengthened with medicine.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	If it is penetrating into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the area, then its sign is that the tentation has entered here if there is no stiffness within the bone, and it causes pain in the passage; and it will be sore forever; and it does not respond to treatment, nor is it solidified with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the healing of them requires work and patience on the part of skilled physicians over whom they are held captive.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in those that are not penetrating or recent, healing with fer (perhaps iron) is hoped for according to what you have been advised and proven before.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And indeed, the illness moves between the patient's legs over their sides, raising their legs inside, the parts lean towards their belly, and then it attempts to penetrate with lead, or iron if in a narrow fistula, into the place where you know the attempt originates.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if that feels like the illness is around the heart, then you must insert your little finger directly into the chest.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel in your little finger the attempt already started and discovered to penetrate, or another thing that feels between the little finger and that, it is certain that it is penetrating; and therefore do not work on that, for there is no cure in that, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	Nevertheless, they say that it heals certain men quickly.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And regarding the treatment by which one hopes for rapid improvement in the patient, it is that you make subtle cauterizations according to the extent of the fistula, as previously described, and insert that hot iron into the fistula until it reaches around the inside; and then repeat this process two or three times until you know that all the flesh around the fistula, which is similar to a reed pen tip, has adhered together.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	Then take care of those wounds wrapped in bandages until all the flesh that is adhered together has healed, and then apply medicines that promote healing and consolidation to the flesh; if it heals well, it is cured; otherwise, it will not be cured in any time through other treatments.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the tent (or probe) does not enter deeply and stops in the area where there is only a thin layer of flesh or bone, and sometimes the fistula is on the surface of the skin, then dry the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and as the drying progresses, you will see the tent (or probe) being pulled out, and thus it is freed and removed.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean those fistulated meats that are assembled like a quill of a pen and not torn for any reason.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	If there is a flow of pus that comes between you and your operation when you inspect those meats, then the best thing to do is use a sharp instrument cauterized with fire or acute medicine, because cauterization with fire closes the two wounds properly: it adjusts those meats attached and removes the pus by drying the humidity.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then care for those wrapped in bandages or tightly bound within that area, and at the same time, treat the plague with hot, hard flesh-generating and consolidating care.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And so these medicines which involve stopping and cutting off; when the treatment is restored, it is healed and you do not fear recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	If the fistula has already penetrated into the perineum and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert the finger into the anus and explore it carefully.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you sense the attempt and between you and it is clearly a foreign body or flesh, and it is prone to penetration, then it is not an operation on it but rather through a path of trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The treatment for this condition involves one of three methods: either cauterizing it as we have mentioned; or drying it out, reaching into the cavity when possible to administer the cure; and not using any incision because you do not want to damage the surrounding tissue or alter the patient's desire; and take care with that as we have said so that the healing is strong. Or elongate that membrane and clean the pus that has formed inside it near the anus, as we have said, either through probing or another instrument of great sharpness, and then excise the infected flesh in the opening made during the section, using cauterization if necessary. Finally, strive to restore the whole wound through incision, and if the orifice does not heal properly, and the fistula remains open at the anus, let it be less severe for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases, the fistula is ended in this manner: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is on the side of the anus around the surface of the body with the cord and on the margin of the anus, then take the attempt to pierce the extreme end, which is thus prepared with a needle according to this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert yourself into that vein wrapped in your fields or around those; then, insert the attempt into the vein within the fistula until you reach its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	If it is inserted into the margin of the anus very close, then you extract the vein from that path as you insert the tip into the anus; you extract the end of the vein and align both ends, then open each one, and leave it for a day or two, and when you again insert the vein into the flesh, open it between those pieces of flesh that are between the two ends of the vein and that fit together.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the opening of the fistula is not deep enough, make it penetrate in some way as you are prepared, either with force or gently, because it is not for you to cause injury; and then treat it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spatula with which the fistula is incised: its curvature is sharp at one end and the other end is not sharp, so as not to cause unnecessary injury when you cut.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the stitching of hemorrhoids where pus runs from the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are said to be of two kinds; either they appear between the buttocks resembling coal, or those are swollen with the grease of inflammation.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And they are small and large, and the sanch (vein) runs from them at that time, it is one, it is mobile, it comes out of the anus, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that are purely anal, according to the few moistures of citrus water or a little vein with continuous flow, are according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for those that are within the anus is that you command the patient to be placed in a certain position so that when the anus contracts and hemorrhoids appear before you, you can express them.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take care and suspend them with pins or what you have at your disposal, and then cut those veins at their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	If the pins are not held in those because of their moisture and softening, then take a coarse cloth or a napkin or a woolen thread, pull out those with your fingers, and then cut them and sprinkle some powders over them after the incision, so that they adhere to that place instead of cauterization; or cauterize them as mentioned previously in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then attend to those and other treatments until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	If the hernia does not yield to treatment, then lacerate the malady with incisions in the areas of pressure, wash those parts in water that aids in expelling the hernia more easily when the malady is squeezed.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, their cause is often slight, and you should apply those with your finger or those with ointment, make incisions in them, and then attend to their healing as we have said above.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	For those who perform incisions, here is how you should administer sutures according to this method: take a length of thread wrapped around the finger and use an needle to extract the hemorrhoids from the splits above, then make the needle penetrate into the root on the other side, and wrap both ends of the thread around the split below the needle, perpendicular; stretch the hemorrhoid with strong tension, tighten the thread, and withdraw the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this continuously, leaving them untouched, so that the excess of blood flow leaves that part.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place a warm, oil-soaked cloth or wax over the affected area and rest it, commanding the patient to do the same.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then remove that cloth and, when it becomes clean, treat the wound with ointment or other remedies until it heals.
De curacio de fistulas.	**Curation of Fistulas**
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Fistulas may occur due to drying out of an opening or due to constriction caused by natural factors.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And when they have been long-standing and no longer respond to those medicines, you should open them with a sharp instrument or with your finger, making sure that the punctures remain moist and are not allowed to form scar tissue, which prevents their healing; and then treat them until they are healed.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Now hold those with a strong reason, more violent than the first that enter, and ensure they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of hernias is crucial.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that hernias are crucial, and not only do they appear according to the color of the skin resembling a nail head, but they occur throughout the body, especially in the groin and sides, and by those pains you should address them.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And so it is incised what is in the ring of the hernia, and held with forceps or a hook, and eradicated from its root; and then care should be taken of that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize according to what is mentioned in the preceding chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	A wart is a small, rough, rounded ulceration on the surface of the body, often seen in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the treatment for it is that you extend and incise that, or open it with a sharp instrument within the wound.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or sharp medicine, as we have said.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And they are now eradicated with both tools as you have said.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	A mosquito is a small, pierced or ulcerated eminence on the surface of the body, often accompanied by itching, and when it bites, it feels similar to a sting from a mosquito, and it is done around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the treatment for it is to take a thin needle of goose or duck feathers, strong and sharp, and place it gently over the swelling within the affected area until it contains the circle of the swelling; then turn your hand over the needle as you inscribe what is in the circuit of the swelling, and place it on the pressure point of the flesh, and you will remove the swelling from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make this as a needle of iron or bronze in this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The departure from the needle should be subtle, silent (not piercing), wrapped around itself so that upon touching the said swelling, it is not affected by its rotation.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want to cauterize the swelling, as described in the cauterization of iron in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of instruments that are administered to give heat.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes heat is given with silver or copper or iron that has been melted or shaped; and sometimes it is given with small or large instruments according to those used in the treatment of small children, which should be small; and for those whose buttocks are frail or painful, the heat from such instruments should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The shape of large and small heat applications:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The end of the tube above which the bag is placed should be wide according to this manner; and it should be distinguished where the bag is attached as well.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of it, which is inserted into the anus, should be blunt (not pointed), bent slightly, and thin; and on one side of its length are two channels, and on the other side a single channel, whose width should correspond to the thickness of the rays and, for small ones, somewhat thinner.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag be filled with animal bladder or sheepskin medicines, and its length be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated through many parts like this when it is twisted, and if the space between the parts is as wide as said.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those parts a strong fiber of raw silk, or surround them; adjust the bag to those parts; and when the bag is positioned on it, tighten it firmly at the base of the patient's genitalia between two distinct points of firm pressure, and properly cauterize each part: but the quality of cauterizing those parts is that you fill the bag with medicine that is warmed according to the amount of the patient's tolerance; and be careful not to make it too tight or too loose.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then have the patient lie on their back, raise their legs up and place under them a cushion or a lance; and apply the end of the cautery to oil or egg white or mucilage of fenugreek or similar substances; and insert it into the anus with ease, and have the assistant take the bag and squeeze it twice hard, and with force, until everything in the genital area is evacuated; then remove the cautery and have the patient raise their legs against the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to vomit, take as much as you can; and if he sleeps through the whole night, it is more beneficial for healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	If you believe that applying heat to the pain of stomach ulcers and vomiting helps, then use cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or abscesses in the anus that hurt, then use a gentle and subtle heat, as the childlike cautery whose tips are cut off.
De curacio de las plaguas.	**Curation of Plagues**
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already stated in the division of the cure for plague what is suitable for the body, and you have thus given the cure for those afflicted with great care and according to medicine's capabilities.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it says that plagues are diversified according to where they are made and according to the place where the plague strikes.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which plagues occur are also due to heat, or an incision of space or of metal, or striking with a lance, or with a staff, or with an arrow, or similar to those causes that bring on sudden illness.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	The plagues that are in the places of the body can also be like the plague which strikes on the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the back, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And it is often recommended for the cure of certain plagues that it stops that reasoning and regulates the others.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And one should begin with the simple plagues of the head, since the recollection of the composite ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, when a simple headache occurs and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is due to the pressure of stone or something similar, and the patient has already taken the necessary medication but the pain is severe and you fear that the condition might progress to apoplexy, then immediately perform a craniotomy and flebotomy, and do not delay; extract the blood from the vein according to the amount of virtue in it, unless there is any other contraindicating cause for flebotomy, especially if the headache that has resulted from the illness is slight.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And flebotomy should be performed opposite the affected area; and pay attention to the patient's rest, diet, and avoid heavy meals.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If any contraindicating cause exists due to the patient's size, then reduce the diet and do not provide meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And regarding the illness, if it is a severe apoplexy, apply a hot compress soaked in olive oil or wine that has been strained.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If you are certain of the infection's severity, apply your treatment to the affected area, if it is fresh and the air has not changed the powder that I will describe in detail later.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has changed that powder, then apply some ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	If the wound is large or due to a laceration and the edges of it are not aligned for proper healing, then adjust them with stitches as I will describe regarding their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the wound has exposed the bone and tendon, and it is not a deep gash but a small suspensory one, then incise it and apply medicine to the wound, restoring the flesh appropriately in place of the damaged area, and instruct the patient to avoid foods that are coarse: caps, hard bread, and similar items, until it heals.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find gangrene in the leg that does not adhere to the bone, you should cut off all the rotted parts and remove them, and then take care of it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If these plagues are caused by an artery or vein from which pus flows and it is not incised by medicines, then you should inquire about the artery, and if you find one that is not incised, you should cut it with a scalpel or tie it off; and if cauterization needs to be done after the pus has been drained.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, their cause is considered minor; so that you sprinkle over them this powder, as it hardens against the air's change.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method of the powder is this: take equal parts of olive oil from crushed sesame seeds, dragon's blood, and non-extinguishable coals; mix it all well, fill the plague with it, and tightly bind it with a good bandage so that the poultice adheres to it, and it coagulates with the pus.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten it over the poultice and leave it, without loosening it while it is in that state so that the medicine does not escape until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And at other times, it is treated solely with cautery, when there is no fever or dragon's blood present.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this surgical procedure is also done for large plagues when it is appropriate to pause them and tighten them, and they are fresh with their own blood, the air of which has not been altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, especially in summer, then one does not understand the position of this poultice, but rather treats them with what we have said: either by placing hot compresses on the inflamed spots or by applying cold compresses to the joints of the sick with water and honey until they get better; and similarly, treat them with other remedies until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	If a fracture of the bone occurs in a small place, then you extract it with a gesture.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And tell the cure for skull fractures where it is dangerous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the ailments of the collarbone.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	If the ailment occurs in the collarbone, its treatment is not different; nor is it distinct from the ailment of the skull when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	If the nerves or arteries of the collarbone are cut, then if it is a nerve, treatment should not be forced but rather the pain should be alleviated through methods that cause less irritation; similarly, as with venom and similar substances, they should be avoided since they can cause further damage to the nerves and contraction.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not attribute any specific cause to the pain, for the substance of the nerves is affected and their continuity is connected to the brain, which is the source of all members' sensations.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is treated with lighter medicines, it is also washed with two types of water, sometimes mixed with perfumed or unperfumed oil, and then dried with hot water and other substances according to this method, and moistened with humidity.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the pain is severe, then a stitch is administered, or the edges of the wound are closed, and then it is treated with poultices until it heals.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or caused by an acute impact in a low-lying part of the body, then it should be pierced at the most sensitive point.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	If an artery is already incised in the plague and blood flow results, then separate or dry it, or tie it, or cauterize it if necessity demands it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If the spine of the ribcage or all of it has been incised and the veins in the neck have been saved, then adjust the edges of the wound with sutures on the rib bone and do not touch that area; equalize that and return it to its natural shape, and tighten it decently, leaving it for some days; and then care for it with poultices where there is stiffness and excitement until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the plague has already made an impression in the bone, then probe it, and if there are fragments of pus within it, extract as many as you can; leave what is not suitable for you, until the plague has dissipated, and it is separated and removed from him.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the affliction is recent, sprinkle that powder which has been recommended on it.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the affliction involves a fistula, then treat it with the water of which the memory will come in its chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the afflictions of the chest or similar, when it begins between the shoulders and is painful to space, or to a rib, or to a lance, or to a bone.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of a lance or a rib, and the depth of the wound is great, then consider more carefully if the affliction has air (puss) when the malady turns; then know that the affliction is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the affliction is recent with its own pus, then you should apply to it in the first hour powder, and do not squeeze it so that the pus is not retained in the depth of the wound and returns to the body, and causes more harm; instead, apply to it a more attractive ointment, and clean it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not at hand, you should stop at the infected wound's edge with a clean cloth to draw out what it has absorbed from moisture; and make the patient rest on the affected area so that what is within runs out properly.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If after three days the wound is healing without incident to the patient—no spasms or tremors of the heart, no constriction of the arteries—and other signs indicate a good prognosis, then you know the illness is in remission; and from that point, apply treatment for pain and any other lingering ailments until complete recovery.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of the wound is accelerated and it remains open for a long time, then know that a fistula has formed; treat it accordingly.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is from a sharp object or blade, and it's superficial on the foot or back, treat it with the method previously described for joint pain, whether it's a large wound requiring stitching or a small one treated with powder.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If a valuable bone has already been broken and you have already extracted the pieces, then twist and cut the plague to extract those pieces if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If the pieces are not separated, leave them inside so that the plague does not spread, as extracting them would be difficult.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidents of the same kind in other parts of the body, the treatment should be the same as that which we have mentioned.
De las plaguas del ventre.	On the stomach plagues.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition that occurs in the stomach can be great, small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	In the case of great pain, one should examine the intestine or abdominal nerves, as there is often an intrusion of them, and their suture (sewing) must be done with both force and subtlety.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And when a small disruption is caused, it is difficult to repair in another manner, and I know that the reduction of them is even more difficult if you do not quickly prevent their intrusion into their place, as they open and thicken, making it difficult for the instrument to enter.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore, the best disruption is to shift it, because in that case the reduction of the hernia is not difficult, as it is in both aforementioned species.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you know that the suture of the abdomen is done in four ways, but two sutures are common and suitable for sutures of other diseases of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And the other two sutures, proper to themselves, communicate with other diseases, but nevertheless they are more proper for the suture of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each of you the exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, it says that when the hernia is small and there is no apparent cause from within the body, and it is difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two ways: either due to the fragility of the rupture as we have said, or when the hernia experiences inflation because of the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so when it is thus, then you should wrap that in a way that you immerse a sponge or cloth moistened in hot water, or take water with vinegar, and turmeric, and spices, and wrap it around the hernia until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And in some cases, they use wine for this, which has a cauterizing effect and is better than just water alone in resolving inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And so when you have determined that the inflammation is resolved, then you should moisten the hernia in water with high levels of salt and mallows, for it thus alleviates the pain caused to it by a slight injury.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	If it is permissible to insert this treatment, then divide the disruption with a small, sharp instrument that incises hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it is appropriate not to cut, and there is no need to dry excessively or deprive of nutrition.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Regarding the instrument, consider its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the instrument is curved sharply, and the other part is not acute, but rather slightly blunt, not too thin like a spatula, but more obtuse.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And thus, when the disease is aggravated and the intestine protrudes, it should be returned to its natural position in its proper place, if possible, as this is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	When the disruption is wide, and it is in the lower part of the belly, you must make the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; but if it is in the upper part of the belly, you should keep their head lower and their legs higher than the pain points.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And seemingly, if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, you must pause your intention and your consideration towards it for a while so that the part where the pain is located becomes higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus, you must also manage this in both great and minor pains.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in minor pains, you should do what you have prepared, and then make the minister be between your most sensitive parts, where the disruption is located, with your hand adjusting the lips of it, and uncovering from one to another until any cause of the suture becomes apparent elsewhere.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count one according to the amount of the width of the wound; then place it near the end of the tear in the finger, and tighten the needle, making sure not to push through both ends of the cord, but only pushing through from within the knot, until you have added the two ends of the cord and the two ends of the phalanx, thus creating four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	Then tighten the thread double around the needle, and in some cases, join two parts together, and add the two lips and the wound through proper addition; take the thickness of the finger and insert another needle into it, just as you did with the first one; do not stop doing this with the needles until you have completely closed the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be in varying thicknesses, ranging from coarse to fine, as the thin needles cut into the flesh lightly; the thick ones are difficult to insert into the cord, so it is necessary that they be medium in both fineness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is important that the needle be inserted into both ends of the affected leg at once, so that the flesh is not cut too deeply and the hernia heals before its closure.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not extend the stitches, so that the hernia is not blocked from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	Then cut the ends of the needles, so they do not puncture the patient again during their sleep; and place over the stitches loose poultices from all sides, which cover the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the hernia is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	These types of stitches use needles in any way most suitable for small hernias, as they are sufficient to close one or two stitches or those around them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second stitch is different: you must close the four ends—the leg and two ends of the abdomen—in one go, with a needle carefully wrapped in thread both thin and thick.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then, when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, withdraw the needle from that middle part where it began, so that the thread retracts and pulls up the pus from the wound, so that the stitching is like a stitch of cloth which is tightly bound.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And between each stitch, leave the thickness of the tip of the finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture teaches men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this type of suture, I have treated a wound that had occurred in a man's belly, which was caused by a blade, and it was a rupture of the wound that was about the size of a palm, and there was an opening around two palms from the middle of the intestinal cavity; and then I had reduced that tissue that the wound had opened in the middle of the member after twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios. De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of sins and the quality of enema administration with medications.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy parts of the body and the space of the abscess is prolonged, forming a collection of pus, then it breaks and perforates itself, and the pus drains out, leaving the area empty as if it had been cut away, and the skin over it remains intact, without any corruption reaching behind it, nor does it affect the bones or nerves or connective tissue. It is called a sinus, and is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged to such an extent that corruption completely envelops a member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.

This disease is called bovine inflammation in some countries because it causes great pain in the limbs and throughout the body, and it pushes and breaks the sinew until it comes out.
